articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: An Israeli strike hit Lebanon's northern city of Tripoli for the first time early on Saturday, a Lebanese security source said, after more bombardment hit Beirut's suburbs and Israeli troops sought to make new ground incursions into southern Lebanon.
articles.title: Israeli strike hits north Lebanon as raids pummel Beirut suburbs

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke, M.B. Pell
articles.description: The arrival of more than half a million school-age children since 2022 has strained school budgets and left teachers grappling with language barriers, a Reuters survey found.
articles.title: An American education: Classrooms reshaped by record migrant arrivals

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on Saturday will return to the rural Pennsylvania site where he was nearly assassinated for a rally in the critical battleground state exactly one month before the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Trump returns to site of assassination attempt in Pennsylvania

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Reem Alyazouri's escape from a bombarded Gaza City through Egypt ended in Toronto on Sept. 4.
articles.title: Long waits for Canadian visas leave Gazans in limbo

articles.author: Fedja Grulovic
articles.description: The country's worst floods in years follow an unprecedented summer drought.
articles.title: Rescue teams search for missing in Bosnia's floods

articles.author: Emilie Madi, Joseph Campbell
articles.description: Migrant worker Fajima Kamara came to Lebanon three years ago from Sierra Leone, but when Israeli jets started pounding her neighbourhood with airstrikes last month, her employers left her jobless and homeless.
articles.title: Lebanon's migrant workers stuck in limbo as thousands flee conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Islamabad is on high alert ahead of diplomatic events including a visit by India's foreign minister.
articles.title: Dozens of Pakistan police injured in clashes with supporters of former PM Khan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of Hungarians gathered outside the headquarters of the country's state television on Saturday, protesting against what they described as the government's "propaganda machine" and calling for an independent public service media.
articles.title: Thousands protest in Hungary demanding end to state media 'propaganda'

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: The head of Austria's far-right Freedom Party, which won this week's parliamentary election, urged other parties on Saturday to accept that he should lead the next government and warned them against forming a "coalition of losers".
articles.title: Austrian far-right head urges rivals to let him govern after election win

articles.author: Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Gazan mother Rana Salah cradles her one-month-old daughter Milana in her arms in a sweltering tent for the displaced, and speaks of the guilt she feels for bringing her child into a world of war and suffering.
articles.title: Displaced Gazan mothers struggle to care for their newborns
